programmes.show_description: Drama series. After Kim plants drugs in her cell, Franky is forced to put her life in jeopardy or ruin her chances of parole. Will finally learns who killed his wife.
The family try to cope with blackouts as their pay-as-you-go meter continually runs out. So Max puts his maths skills to good use and comes up with some (extreme) energy saving tips.
It's Noel and Sue's 30th wedding anniversary, and the kids decide they deserve to have a break away from them all. But will their plans work out?
Paul and Tom Keane go head-to-head for a mystery jackpot prize that could hugely increase their profits at auction. Which of them will win the walnut vitrine or the art deco-styled lamp? (Ep27)

A tiny kitten called Magic has been  found on his own by a main road in the middle of the night. He's too young to be away from his mum, so Peter's called in to help.
In the new series, as well as tackling canine behavioural issues, Graeme Hall opens his new puppy school. Plus, a hellhound who's tearing a family apart, and viewers' doggie dilemmas.

programmes.show_name: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programmes.show_description: Ben journeys to southeast Asia to live with a 31-year-old former city slicker in his hand-made bamboo hut on a hidden jungle island.
By early 1943, Germany is losing the battle in the Atlantic But Hitler is one step ahead, ordering a submarine capable of fast underwater speeds and phenomenal firepower.
Jessica Fletcher helps Seth solve a problem within the family after his cousin, an expert on plants, gets in a heated argument over a newly-developed tree.
Jessica comes to give aid to a good friend who is somehow involved in the theft of a priceless Egyptian artifact.
A desperate woman in love murders her own brother to gain control of the family business. (1971)
A chance to see some of Juian and Peter's best bits as they come to the aid of all creatures - great and small.
Bill Nighy narrates a 600-mile journey through stunning Finland from Helsinki to Lapland and the Northern Lights.
Rob Bell reveals the dramatic story of Ark Royal. World War Two's most famous aircraft carrier, which hunted down some of Nazi Germany's most feared warships.
Exploring the 'Blitzkrieg' via the extraordinary ruins that tell the story of a revolution in tactics and weapons that almost gives Hitler the chance to create his Thousand Year Reich.

programmes.show_name: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programmes.show_description: Adventurer Ben Fogle ventures into the Appalachian mountains of Tennessee to live with the youngest 'wild' man he has visited to date.
The chief suspect in a murder has the perfect alibi, but DCI Taggart is convinced he is guilty. Meanwhile, DS Jardine investigates escalating racial attacks at a block of flats.
A look back at outrageous events of '74, replaying the most controversial moments in TV, cinema, music, showbiz and politics, including film The Exorcist, TV's Tiswas and the 3-day working week.
Beauty clinic owner Michelle and her friend Liz swap with unemployed single mum Amy and daughter Phoebe as they find how work and confidence can triumph over mental health issues.
A hard-up trio of friends are treated like royalty at a prestigious chateau in France, swapping with two pals who exchange their five-star hotels for a no-frills Norfolk campsite.
Rob Bell explores the history and engineering behind Britain's Greatest Bridges. A look at the Britannia Bridge. (Ep 1)

A deserted Spanish town scarred by its brutal wartime past, a ghostly fleet of ships, and a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest are all investigated to uncover why they were abandoned.

programmes.show_name: New: Battlefront: WWII Road to Victory
programmes.show_description: The Allies launch an ill-fated attack on the German-occupied port of Dieppe, France, where the Nazis proved to be too strong.

programmes.show_name: New: Battlefront: WWII Road to Victory
programmes.show_description: At the Battle of Stalingrad, the besieged Soviet Red Army turned the tables on the German Army.
On 1st September 1939, 1.5 million German soldiers poured into Poland, beginning the countdown to the 2nd World War. JJ Chalmers and Raksha Dave tell the dramatic story. (Ep1)
JJ Chalmers and Raksha Dave explore 2nd September 1939, as Germany's invasion of Poland escalates. RAF recruits deploy, London hospitals are emptied and Parliament braces for war. (Ep2)
On 3rd September 1939, Britain declared war. After a tense ultimatum and false alarm, British planes saw their first action and the SS Athenia was torpedoed, marking the first casualties. (Ep3)
